name: Round 1
fact: Americans consume about 50 billion burgers a year, averaging three burgers per week.

name: Round 2
fact: Americans consume more than 21 pounds of ketchup per person each year.

name: Round 3
fact: Calling ground beef “hamburger” dates from the invention of the mechanical meat grinder in the 1860s.

name: Round 4
fact: The Guinness World Records holder for largest hamburger in the world was in Germany on July 9, 2017, weighing in at 2,566 pounds, 9 ounces.

name: Round 5
fact: 64% of potatoes used in the U.S. are processed — an amount that has almost doubled since the 1960s after improvements in frozen french-fry processing and the increased popularity of fast-food chains.
